chemoreception.notes: As demosponges, Polymastiidae likely rely heavily on chemoreception to detect food particles and environmental cues in the water column. This is inferred from the general biology of sponges.

mechanoreception.notes: Sponges generally possess mechanoreceptors to sense water flow and physical disturbances. Polymastiidae likely use this sense to coordinate filter feeding and respond to environmental changes.

photoreception.notes: The presence of photoreception in Polymastiidae is currently unknown. The provided text does not give any indication of this sensory modality.
